#Text=Defend Your Religion
#Text=" But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts , and be ready always to give an answer to every man who asketh you a reason for the hope that is in you , with meekness and fear . "

column1: #Text=1 Peter 3:15It is estimated that there are roughly 4200 religions in the world right now .
#Text=Some of those religions are bound to contradict and many people are intolerant of certain religions .
#Text=It is inevitable that at some point in your life your religion will be criticized and you will have to defend your beliefs .
#Text=This article will show you the most important tips .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Preparation
#Text=Develop a deep understanding of your religion for yourself before arguing with anyone .
#Text=You cannot successfully explain or defend something that you do not know .
#Text=If you do not understand your religion yourself , you may end up giving out the wrong information and misrepresenting it .
#Text=No matter how good your debating skills are , the most important ingredient for any debate is knowledge .
#Text=It is essential to familiarize yourself with the doctrine and teachings of your religion .
#Text=Attend sermons or lessons frequently to familiarize yourself with the teachings of it .
#Text=Always ask questions whenever there is anything you do not understand .
#Text=Be sure to ask someone who is knowledgeable in your religion ( Minister , Imam , Priest , etc. )

#Text=Familiarize yourself with your religion 's texts ( Bible , Torah , Quran , etc. ) , this is important because it is likely that critics will cite this text as evidence against the validity/morality of your religion .
#Text=Learn the most common criticisms .
#Text=It is likely that certain criticisms against your religion are used more often than others .
#Text=If you familiarize yourself with the most common criticisms used against your religion , you will be prepared to rebut most criticisms against it .
#Text=Understand what is literal and what is metaphorical .

#Text=When Jesus said , " if your eye offend thee , pluck it out , " he was not telling you to literally gouge out your own eye ; it was figurative language , which is common in many religious texts .

#Text=It is important to learn the whether or not certain passages of text are symbolic or literal , because certain metaphorical texts may be found to be objectionable by critics if interpreted literally .
#Text=Learn what the apologists say .
#Text=This is one of the quickest ways to learn many defenses against criticisms of your religion .
#Text=Search online and see if there are any apologetic sites dedicated to defending your religion .
#Text=Go to your local bookstore or library and get books dedicated to defending your religion
#Text=Watch Debates .
#Text=Check YouTube or other video sites to see if there are any debates where your religion is being defended .
#Text=Analyse the apologist and the critic and ask yourself :
#Text=Did the apologist do a good job of defending your beliefs ?
#Text=Why/why not ?
#Text=What would you have done differently ?
#Text=What points did the apologist bring up ?
#Text=How would you modify them ?
#Text=What points did the critic bring up ?
#Text=How would you respond to them ?
#Text=Discussion
#Text=Watch out for strawman arguments .
#Text=Watch out for ad hominem fallacies .
#Text=An ad hominem fallacy is when someone 's argument is dismissed because of who they are or some fact about them , when the argument should be evaluated on its own merit .
#Text=There are several different types of ad hominemAbusive :
#Text=Note that some instances of ad hominem are not fallacious , such as situations when the argument directly has something to do with the person being criticized .
#Text=Watch out quotations out of context .
#Text=Watch out for appeals to ridicule .
#Text=Watch out for loaded language .
#Text=Honestly answer all honest questions .
#Text=It shows integrety and credibility if you are able to answer the critics questions .
#Text=Watch out for misinterpreations
#Text=Civility
#Text=Stay calm
#Text=Avoid insults .
#Text=Avoid interrupting and ask that the critic do the same .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Understand that there are some people who simply will not listen to your defense no matter what .
#Text=If it is obvious that that is the case , it may be a better idea to simply leave them alone .
